item.description:
Portugal's Fado singer, Mariza, will be playing at the Berklee Performance Center.

For those who do not know Fado, it is Portugal's traditional folk music dating back centuries and influenced by the Moors. It is quite a powerful and dramatic form of emotional expression of "saudade" (longing, sentiment, and sorrow).

I realize Fado is not for everyone, however it will be quite a show.

I ask that people buy their own tickets and as we get closer to the date, I will arrange for a gathering before the show.

Here is some more information about Mariza. Also included are links to online ticket purchasing.

Mariza is a charismatic fado singer with a clarion voice and mesmerizing stage presence. Her hauntingly beautiful sound seems to bleed saudade, the uniquely Portuguese passion that roughly translates as "sorrowful longing." Whether singing traditional numbers or new songs, Mariza honors the legacy of fado, Portugal's expressive lament of destiny.
